intro: Sanchezia munita, commonly known as the red-veined sanchezia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with deep red veins against a dark green background. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often clustered in inflorescences. Sanchezia munita is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its ornamental foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
